channel.title: Making a rsps with no lag?
channel.description: Is there anyway that I can host a server without worrying about my ram? If there's not... if 4gb good enough? thanks guys!

item.title: Making a rsps with no lag?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Logitek, post:2, topic:383351”]i think ure internet speed is more important than ure RAM but not having a poorly wirtten server could help.
my advice: get a vps.[/quote]
He is correct. get a vps with good memory and lots of ram. they are PRICY but if you ever want a epic server with lots of people. you will need one

Read full topic

item.source: Making a rsps with no lag?

item.title: Making a rsps with no lag?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:17, topic:383351”]First off, if you don’t want any lag, you’ll need a server that is actually written correctly, such as Hyperion. Most of the servers you find here, regardless of the client version they use, will lag horribly when more players start to join. Also, their CPU and RAM usage will probably skyrocket, due to poor programming and memory leaks.

However, since I am assuming that you are using one of these servers, you’ll want a computer, or a VPS, with enough RAM and a powerful enough CPU to handle however many players who get. If you are running it from home, you’ll also want a good internet connection.[/quote]

Hyperion [this one] doesn’t work for me, it says something about a file not existing and won’t run.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a rsps with no lag?

item.title: Making a rsps with no lag?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

First off, if you don’t want any lag, you’ll need a server that is actually written correctly, such as Hyperion. Most of the servers you find here, regardless of the client version they use, will lag horribly when more players start to join. Also, their CPU and RAM usage will probably skyrocket, due to poor programming and memory leaks.

However, since I am assuming that you are using one of these servers, you’ll want a computer, or a VPS, with enough RAM and a powerful enough CPU to handle however many players who get. If you are running it from home, you’ll also want a good internet connection.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a rsps with no lag?

item.title: Making a rsps with no lag?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

My old computer has 35mb Ram, and I can host a server on it fine…

90% of it depends on the server.

Your server probably has tons of useless shit jammed into the process() { method in client.java, or is just poorly written.

Read full topic
